perturbation.original_text: Effective as of the Initial Closing Date, the Seller hereby grants (and will cause each other Seller Party to grant following each applicable Closing Date), to the Purchaser Licensees an irrevocable (except as expressly set forth herein), perpetual, non-sublicenseable (except as expressly set forth herein), fully paid-up, royalty-free, worldwide, non-transferable (except as expressly set forth herein), non-exclusive license, under the Licensed Patents:
perturbation.changed_text: Effective as of the Initial Closing Date, the Seller hereby provides (and will cause each other Seller Party to provide following each applicable Closing Date), to the Purchaser Licensees a revocable (except as expressly set forth herein), limited-time, non-sublicenseable (except as expressly set forth herein), fully paid-up, royalty-free, worldwide, non-transferable (except as expressly set forth herein), non-exclusive permit, under the Licensed Patents:
perturbation.explanation: The term 'grants' is replaced with 'provides,' 'irrevocable' is replaced with 'revocable,' 'perpetual' is replaced with 'limited-time' and 'license' is replaced with 'permit.' This creates an internal contradiction regarding the duration and nature of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: (i) (A) to use the Licensed Patents in the operation of the Business and to practice any methods, processes, and procedures in connection therewith and (B) to make, have made, use, sell, offer for sale, import and otherwise dispose of products, services, and systems that were designed, developed, manufactured, distributed, offered for sale, sold, resold, supported, otherwise under development, or provided, as of the applicable Closing Date, by the Seller Entities in connection with the Business and to practice any methods, processes, and procedures in connection therewith, and in each case of clauses (A) and (B), including with respect to all Derivative Works and natural evolutions thereof; and
perturbation.changed_text: (i) (A) to utilize the Licensed Patents in the operation of the Enterprise and to execute any methodologies, workflows, and operations in connection therewith and (B) to create, have created, utilize, vend, display for sale, import, and otherwise discard of commodities, amenities, and frameworks that were conceived, progressed, fabricated, disseminated, showcased for sale, traded, retailed, upheld, otherwise under expansion, or furnished, as of the applicable Closing Date, by the Seller Entities in conjunction with the Enterprise and to execute any methodologies, workflows, and operations in connection therewith, and in each case of clauses (A) and (B), including with respect to all Derivative Works and natural evolutions thereof; and
perturbation.explanation: Multiple terms are changed to introduce inconsistency such as 'use' to 'utilize', 'practice' to 'execute', 'methods, processes and procedures' to 'methodologies, workflows, and operations', 'Business' to 'Enterprise', 'make' to 'create', 'dispose of' to 'discard of', and 'services' to 'amenities'

perturbation.original_text: The term of this IP Agreement shall be from the Effective Date until all of the Intellectual Property licensed hereunder is in the public domain (provided, however, that in such event the representations and warranties in Article III shall survive (and terminate) in accordance with the Acquisition Agreement) or this IP Agreement is terminated pursuant to Section 4.3. This IP Agreement shall not expire or terminate for any other reason (even in the event of a material breach).
perturbation.changed_text: The duration of this IP Agreement starts from the Effective Date until all of the Intellectual Works permitted here is in the people's domain (provided, however, that in such event the representations and guarantees in Article III shall survive (and terminate) in accordance with the Acquisition Agreement) or this IP Agreement is ended as per Section 4.3. This IP Agreement shall not cease or come to an end for any other ground (even in the event of a substantial violation).
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'term' to 'duration,' 'Intellectual Property licensed' to 'Intellectual Works permitted,' 'public domain' to 'people's domain,' 'terminated' to 'ended,' 'expire or terminate' to 'cease or come to an end' and 'material breach' to 'substantial violation' introduces misaligned terminology.
